Columns.summary: Columns definitions. Set it only when the panel has no files.
Columns.remarks:
Items of this array are similar to Format-Table parameter -Property items. Strings define properties and the same column names; hashtables provide more information: properties or script blocks, column titles, widths, types, and format strings. See remarks about use of dictionaries as items and about column types.
Columns of can be mapped only to properties, that is to data table fields. Script blocks are not supported.
Special case: 'N' column (Name) of is always mapped to the PSChildName for providers with container items (e.g. Registry). For this column any custom data source is ignored. But it has to be included to describe other information: position, title, width, format string. Note: if column types are not specified then normally the first column is treated as 'N'.

remarks.para: These handles are used by but often they are added to and then internally passed in its child .

Example: if this is a then the added handler will be called when [Enter] is pressed on its child file with the specified name. Normally the task of this handler is to start another table containing values to be selected and to set a handler triggered on [Enter] there (see ). Example script: Test-Panel-DbNotes-.ps1.
